text: {{Infobox writer | name = Abu Nuwas | image = Abu Nuwas.jpg | image_size = 180px | alt = | caption = Abu Nuwas, as drawn by Khalil Gibran in 1916. | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = 756 | birth_place = | death_date = - Baghdad | death_place = | resting_place = | occupation = Poet | language = | nationality = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | influences = | influenced = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | portaldisp = }} Abū Nuwās al-Ḥasan ibn Hānī al-Ḥakamī (variant: Al-Ḥasan ibn Hānī 'Abd al-Awal al-Ṣabāḥ, Abū 'Alī (), known as Abū Nuwās al-Salamī () or just Abū NuwāsGarzanti ( Abū Novās); 756814) was a classical Arabic poet. He was born in Persia. He is in The Book of One Thousand and One Nights. == References == Category:750 births Category:810 deaths Category:Iranian poets Category:Pen names
